text: Liceo Agustín Ross Edwards () is a Chilean public (municipal) high school located in Pichilemu, Cardenal Caro Province. It is named after Agustín Ross Edwards, a Chilean politician and known for building the historic centre of the town of Pichilemu. The high school was created in 1979, and works as a Humanistic Scientific high school. The high school has employed the Complete Scholar Journey () since 1998.Acerca del Liceo Agustín Ross Edwards The Liceo Agustín Ross Edwards' principal is Hipólito Segundo Solano Rubio. As of 2012, LARE had 562 students, and 38 teachers. The president of the parents' center (centro de padres) is Marco Antonio Salgado Contreras, and the president of the students' center (centro de alumnos) is Matías Lizana Calderón. == References == == External links == * Category:Educational institutions established in 1979 Category:Secondary schools in Chile Category:Schools in Cardenal Caro Province Category:Education in Pichilemu Category:Organizations based in Pichilemu Category:Buildings and structures in Pichilemu Category:1979 establishments in Chile
title: Liceo Agustín Ross Edwards
